    "comment": [
        "This sequence can also be generated by the N-sieve."
    ],
    "link": [
        "Michael De Vlieger, <a href=\"/A333243/b333243.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000</a>",
        "Michael P. May, <a href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/1608.08082\">On the Properties of Special Prime Number Subsequences</a>, arXiv:1608.08082 [math.GM], 2016-2020.",
        "Michael P. May, <a href=\"https://doi.org/10.35834/2020/3202158\">Properties of Higher-Order Prime Number Sequences</a>, Missouri J. Math. Sci. (2020) Vol. 32, No. 2, 158-170; and <a href=\"https://arxiv.org/abs/2108.04662\">arXiv version</a>, arXiv:2108.04662 [math.NT], 2021."
    ],
    "formula": [
        "a(n) = prime(A262275(n))."
    ],
    "example": [
        "a(1) = prime(A262275(1)) = prime(3) = 5."
    ],
    "maple": [
        "b:= proc(n) option remember;",
        "      `if`(isprime(n), 1+b(numtheory[pi](n)), 0)",
        "    end:",
        "a:= proc(n) option remember; local p;",
        "      p:= `if`(n=1, 1, a(n-1));",
        "      do p:= nextprime(p);",
        "        if (h-> h>1 and h::odd)(b(p)) then break fi",
        "      od; p",
        "    end:",
        "seq(a(n), n=1..50);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Mar 15 2020"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "b[n_] := b[n] = If[PrimeQ[n], 1+b[PrimePi[n]], 0];",
        "a[n_] := a[n] = Module[{p}, p = If[n==1, 1, a[n-1]]; While[True, p = NextPrime[p]; If[#>1 && OddQ[#]&[b[p]], Break[]]]; p];",
        "Array[a, 50] (* _Jean-Fran\u00e7ois Alcover_, Nov 16 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)"
    ],
    "program": [
        "(PARI) b(n)={my(k=0); while(isprime(n), k++; n=primepi(n)); k};",
        "apply(x->prime(prime(x)), select(n->b(n)%2, [1..500])) \\\\ _Michel Marcus_, Nov 18 2022"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A078442, A262275, A333242, A333244."
    ],
